sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"椅子，凳子"之意。
means: chair ： 通常指带有靠背的椅子，有时也指有靠背有扶手的椅子。
bench ： 指可供两人或更多人坐的长凳或石凳，多置于公园或划艇中。
stool ： 多指方的或圆的无靠背无扶手一人坐的凳子。

sentence.Network_en: She sank into an armchair and crossed her legs.
sentence.Network_cn: 她坐到一把扶手椅上，跷起了二郎腿。

sentence.Network_en: She was sitting in an armchair with blankets wrapped round her.
sentence.Network_cn: 她坐在扶手椅中，身上裹着毯子。

sentence.Network_en: He was nodding off to sleep in an armchair.
sentence.Network_cn: 他坐在扶手椅上打盹，睡着了。

...，根据美联社报道，泰格-伍兹的经纪人星期二批评了汉克-哈尼的新书，他表示汉克-哈尼对于伍兹的点评是“空谈心理学(armchair psychology)”，真是“荒谬透顶”。他同时相信汉克-哈尼这样做完全是为了自我推销。

entry.def: An armchair is a big comfortable chair which has a support on each side for your arms.

example.ex: She was sitting in an armchair with blankets wrapped round her.
example.tran: 她坐在扶手椅中，身上裹着毯子。

entry.tran: （通过阅读或倾听）间接了解的，非亲身经历的
entry.def: An armchair critic, fan, or traveller knows about a particular subject from reading or hearing about it rather than from practical experience.

example.ex: The last thing we need are words of wisdom from an armchair critic...
example.tran: 我们最不需要的是纸上谈兵的评论家发表的“智慧”言论。

example.ex: This great book is ideal for both the travelling supporter and the armchair fan.
example.tran: 这本好书对于喜欢出门旅行的人和足不出户的神游爱好者都是理想的选择。

means.word_mean: 1. chair with a support on each side for arms

auth_sentence.res_content: Supporting me, he steered me to an armchair.

sentences.en: I was so tired I crashed out in an armchair.
sentences.cn: 我十分疲倦,在扶手椅上睡着了。

sentences.en: I saw him sitting back in the armchair,drinking his beer.
sentences.cn: 我看见他背靠扶手椅而坐,喝着啤酒。

sentences.en: I love curling up in an armchair with a good book.
sentences.cn: 我爱在扶手椅上蜷作一团看我喜欢的书。

sentences.en: She sat in an armchair by the fire, reading a newspaper.
sentences.cn: 她坐在炉火边的扶手椅中读报纸。

means.word_mean: 只说不做的；空谈的；不切实际的
